justification: The text discusses using the EQ-5D to assess utility weights in patients with coronary artery disease, indicating it as a valid measure for HRQL in specified contexts.
The CONSORT-PRO Extension is mentioned as a framework for assessing and reporting PROs in publications, pointing to its role as a measurement guideline for improving the quality of PRO reporting.
The paper discusses the importance of theoretical frameworks in guiding what needs to be assessed when selecting PROMs, underscoring their role in the accurate measurement of constructs.
The EQ-5D is again referenced as a measure for QOL, with concerns about its use and reporting quality highlighting its role as a key instrument in assessing QOL.
